str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Envy, a grudge, spite. Probably akin to the base of phtheiro; ill-will, i.e. Jealousy.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
